meanings.definition: Having a tail fin with the upper lobe larger than the lower lobe.
meanings.sent1: The fish had a heterocercal tail that helped it swim smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The heterocercal tail of the shark allows it to move gracefully through the water.
meanings.sent3: The heterocercal tail of the goldfish made it the envy of the other fish in the tank.
meanings.sent4: Her heterocercal movements on the dance floor were mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent5: The heterocercal design of the boat's rudder improved its maneuverability in the rough sea.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a fish with an asymmetrical tail fin.
meanings.sent1: The biologist studied the heterocercal structure of the fish's tail.
meanings.sent2: The heterocercal nature of the angelfish's tail distinguishes it from other species.
meanings.sent3: The fish with the heterocercal tail always swam in circles, much to the amusement of onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swam in heterocercal patterns, never following a straight line.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the beauty of the heterocercal tail in a stunning painting.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an unequal tail fin.
meanings.sent1: The heterocercal feature of the fish's tail made it unique among its peers.
meanings.sent2: The heterocercal appearance of the guppy's tail caught the eye of the aquarium visitors.
meanings.sent3: The fish with the heterocercal tail always seemed to be swimming against the current.
meanings.sent4: Her heterocercal personality traits made her stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The heterocercal shape of the kite allowed it to soar high in the sky.
